title: Yak File
body: Yaks, native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia, are robust, shaggy-haired mammals well-adapted to the challenging mountain environments. Renowned for their resilience, yaks serve as essential resources for local communities, providing milk, meat, and wool. Their distinctive, long, curved horns and thick, insulated fur enable them to thrive in harsh conditions, making them valuable assets for nomadic herders. Yaks have played a crucial role in the cultural and economic fabric of the Himalayan and Tibetan Plateau regions, embodying a symbol of endurance and adaptability in extreme climates.
